source.title: Know Your Lender, Grow Your Business
source.publisher: Ministry of MSME, Government of India
source.notes: Curated local RAG chunks from Sections 1, 5, 8, 9, 10 and Annexure-B

chunks.title: PMMY (MUDRA) eligibility and slabs
chunks.content: PMMY supports income-generating micro enterprises in manufacturing, trading and services with loans up to Rs 20 lakh. Categories: Shishu up to Rs 50,000; Kishor above Rs 50,000 up to Rs 5 lakh; Tarun above Rs 5 lakh up to Rs 10 lakh; Tarun Plus above Rs 10 lakh up to Rs 20 lakh for entrepreneurs who successfully repaid Tarun.

chunks.title: PMEGP new enterprise rules
chunks.content: PMEGP is a credit-linked subsidy scheme for setting up new micro enterprises. Maximum project cost: Rs 50 lakh for manufacturing and Rs 20 lakh for services. Subsidy range: 15% to 35%. No collateral for loans up to Rs 10 lakh. EDP training is mandatory.

chunks.title: PM Vishwakarma artisan support
chunks.content: PM Vishwakarma provides holistic support to traditional artisans and craftspeople: certificate/ID, skill training, toolkit incentive and collateral-free credit support in two tranches, with digital enablement and marketing support.

chunks.title: NULM urban self-employment financing
chunks.content: NULM supports urban poor individuals and SHGs for micro-enterprises. Individuals can avail up to Rs 2 lakh, SHGs up to Rs 10 lakh. Loans up to Rs 10 lakh are collateral-free.

chunks.title: NRLM rural women SHG financing
chunks.content: NRLM promotes rural financial inclusion through women-led SHGs, providing revolving funds, interest subvention and collateral-free loans up to Rs 10 lakh.

chunks.title: MSE-GIFT green transition support
chunks.content: MSE-GIFT promotes adoption of green technologies in MSEs with 2% interest subvention on term loans up to Rs 2 crore and credit guarantee support up to 75% of eligible loans.

chunks.title: MSE-SPICE circular economy subsidy
chunks.content: MSE-SPICE offers capital subsidy for circular economy/waste management projects: 25% of plant and machinery investment or Rs 12.5 lakh, whichever is lower, for projects up to Rs 50 lakh. Focus sectors include plastic, rubber and e-waste.

chunks.title: GST Sahay invoice-based financing
chunks.content: GST Sahay enables collateral-free invoice-based financing for GST-registered and Udyam-registered micro and small enterprises. It supports purchase and sales invoice financing with fast digital disbursal.

chunks.title: PSB Loans in 59 Minutes portal
chunks.content: PSB Loans in 59 Minutes provides digital in-principle approvals and lender matching for credit facilities ranging from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 5 crore through banks and NBFCs.

chunks.title: CGTMSE/credit guarantee support
chunks.content: Credit guarantee regimes support lending to MSMEs. CGTMSE enables collateral-free credit access for underserved MSE segments with guarantee cover support. CGSS supports DPIIT-recognized startups with guarantee cover.

chunks.title: Collateral-free norms for MSME loans
chunks.content: As per RBI guidance, banks should not insist on collateral security for MSE loans up to Rs 10 lakh. For PMEGP units, collateral-free lending up to Rs 10 lakh is advised. With strong track record, banks may extend collateral-free loans up to Rs 25 lakh with due approval.

chunks.title: Core loan documentation and statutory checklist
chunks.content: Typical documents include PAN and Aadhaar, Udyam registration, GST certificate/returns, income tax returns, bank statements, business address proof and financial statements. For higher exposure, lenders require projected financials, audited balance sheets and detailed project reports.

chunks.title: Key Fact Statement (KFS), APR and borrower rights
chunks.content: Regulated entities must provide KFS to borrowers in understandable language with APR computation and amortisation schedule. Charges not disclosed in KFS should not be imposed without explicit borrower consent.

chunks.title: NPA trigger and consequences
chunks.content: A loan generally becomes NPA when principal or interest remains overdue for more than 90 days. NPA classification reduces borrower credit profile and can affect future access to credit-linked schemes and lower-cost borrowing.
